article.headline: Vermont 83, Stony Brook 72
article.story: EDS: APNewsNow. Vermont 83, Stony Brook 72. STONY BROOK, N.Y. -- Junior Marqus Blakely scored 20 points, including the 1,000th of his career, and Vermont beat Stony Brook 83-72 on Saturday. Blakely was 7-for-10 from the field and had five rebounds, three steals and two blocks for the Catamounts (11-6, 2-2 America East). He became the 28th player in Vermont history to reach 1,000 points. Mike Trimboli added 15 points and five assists for the Catamounts, while Joey Accaoui had a career-high 15 points, Maurice Joseph had 12 -- all on 3-pointers -- and Nick Vier added 11. Chris Martin had 17 points for Stony Brook (9-8, 1-3), while Muhammad El-Amin added 15, Dallis Joyner 14 and Bryan Dougher 13. Blakely made two free throws with 11:22 left to give Vermont a 51-39 lead, but Stony Brook responded with an 18-7 run over the next 6:21 to get within 58-57. Vermont then went on a 16-3 run to go ahead 73-60.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
